Events.text: Attila the Hun sacks the town of Metz and attacks other cities in Gaul.
Events.html: Attila the Hun sacks the town of Metz and attacks other cities in Gaul.

Events.text: First draft of the Corpus Juris Civilis (a fundamental work in jurisprudence) is issued by Eastern Roman Emperor Justinian I.
Events.html: First draft of the Corpus Juris Civilis (a fundamental work in jurisprudence) is issued by Eastern Roman Emperor Justinian I.

Events.text: Maya king Uneh Chan of Calakmul sacks rival city-state Palenque in southern Mexico.
Events.html: Maya king Uneh Chan of Calakmul sacks rival city-state Palenque in southern Mexico.

Events.text: Empress Matilda became the first female ruler of England, adopting the title 'Lady of the English'.
Events.html: Empress Matilda became the first female ruler of England, adopting the title 'Lady of the English'.

Events.text: Charles University is founded in Prague.
Events.html: Charles University is founded in Prague.

Events.text: Ferdinand Magellan arrives at Cebu.
Events.html: Ferdinand Magellan arrives at Cebu.

Events.text: Francis Xavier leaves Lisbon on a mission to the Portuguese East Indies.
Events.html: Francis Xavier leaves Lisbon on a mission to the Portuguese East Indies.

Events.text: Premiere performance of Johann Sebastian Bach's St John Passion BWV 245 at St. Nicholas Church, Leipzig.
Events.html: Premiere performance of Johann Sebastian Bach's St John Passion BWV 245 at St. Nicholas Church, Leipzig.

Events.text: End of Burmese–Siamese War (1765–67).
Events.html: End of Burmese–Siamese War (1765–67).

Events.text: Captain John Barry and the USS Lexington captures the Edward.
Events.html: Captain John Barry and the USS Lexington captures the Edward.

Events.text: American pioneers to the Northwest Territory establish Marietta, Ohio as the first permanent American settlement in the Northwest Territory.
Events.html: American pioneers to the Northwest Territory establish Marietta, Ohio as the first permanent American settlement in the Northwest Territory.

links.title: American pioneers to the Northwest Territory

Events.text: Selim III became Sultan of the Ottoman Empire and Caliph of Islam.
Events.html: Selim III became Sultan of the Ottoman Empire and Caliph of Islam.

Events.text: The Mississippi Territory is organized from disputed territory claimed by both the United States and Spain. It is expanded in 1804 and again in 1812.
Events.html: The Mississippi Territory is organized from disputed territory claimed by both the United States and Spain. It is expanded in 1804 and again in 1812.

Events.text: Lewis and Clark Expedition: The Corps of Discovery breaks camp among the Mandan tribe and resumes its journey West along the Missouri River.
Events.html: Lewis and Clark Expedition: The Corps of Discovery breaks camp among the Mandan tribe and resumes its journey West along the Missouri River.

Events.text: German composer Ludwig van Beethoven premiered his Third Symphony, at the Theater an der Wien in Vienna.
Events.html: German composer Ludwig van Beethoven premiered his Third Symphony, at the Theater an der Wien in Vienna.

Events.text: John Walker, an English chemist, sells the first friction match that he had invented the previous year.
Events.html: John Walker, an English chemist, sells the first friction match that he had invented the previous year.

Events.text: Joseph Smith, founder of the Latter Day Saint movement, commences translation of the Book of Mormon, with Oliver Cowdery as his scribe.
Events.html: Joseph Smith, founder of the Latter Day Saint movement, commences translation of the Book of Mormon, with Oliver Cowdery as his scribe.

Events.text: Emperor Pedro I of Brazil resigns. He goes to his native Portugal to become King Pedro IV.
Events.html: Emperor Pedro I of Brazil resigns. He goes to his native Portugal to become King Pedro IV.

Events.text: American Civil War: The Union's Army of the Tennessee and the Army of the Ohio defeat the Confederate Army of Mississippi near Shiloh, Tennessee.
Events.html: American Civil War: The Union's Army of the Tennessee and the Army of the Ohio defeat the Confederate Army of Mississippi near Shiloh, Tennessee.

Events.text: Thomas D'Arcy McGee, one of the Canadian Fathers of Confederation is assassinated by a Fenian activist.
Events.html: Thomas D'Arcy McGee, one of the Canadian Fathers of Confederation is assassinated by a Fenian activist.

Events.text: Completion of the first Lake Biwa Canal.
Events.html: Completion of the first Lake Biwa Canal.

Events.text: Mount Vesuvius erupts and devastates Naples.
Events.html: Mount Vesuvius erupts and devastates Naples.

Events.text: The Algeciras Conference gives France and Spain control over Morocco.
Events.html: 1906 – The Algeciras Conference gives France and Spain control over Morocco.

Events.text: H. H. Asquith of the Liberal Party takes office as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, succeeding Sir Henry Campbell-Bannerman.
Events.html: H. H. Asquith of the Liberal Party takes office as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, succeeding Sir Henry Campbell-Bannerman.

links.title: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

Events.text: The United States Secretary of the Interior leases federal petroleum reserves to private oil companies on excessively generous terms.
Events.html: The United States Secretary of the Interior leases federal petroleum reserves to private oil companies on excessively generous terms.

links.title: United States Secretary of the Interior

Events.text: The first long-distance public television broadcast (from Washington, D.C., to New York City, displaying the image of Commerce Secretary Herbert Hoover).
Events.html: The first long-distance public television broadcast (from Washington, D.C., to New York City, displaying the image of Commerce Secretary Herbert Hoover).

Events.text: Prohibition in the United States is repealed for beer of no more than 3.2% alcohol by weight, eight months before the ratification of the XXI amendment. (Now celebrated as National Beer Day in the United States of America)
Events.html: Prohibition in the United States is repealed for beer of no more than 3.2% alcohol by weight, eight months before the ratification of the XXI amendment. (Now celebrated as National Beer Day in the United States of America)

links.title: Twenty-first Amendment to the United States Constitution

Events.text: World War II: Italy invades Albania.
Events.html: World War II: Italy invades Albania.

Events.text: Booker T. Washington becomes the first African American to be depicted on a United States postage stamp.
Events.html: Booker T. Washington becomes the first African American to be depicted on a United States postage stamp.

Events.text: The Holocaust: In Terebovlia, Ukraine, Germans order 1,100 Jews to undress and march through the city to the nearby village of Plebanivka, where they are shot and buried in ditches.
Events.html: The Holocaust: In Terebovlia, Ukraine, Germans order 1,100 Jews to undress and march through the city to the nearby village of Plebanivka, where they are shot and buried in ditches.

Events.text: Ioannis Rallis becomes collaborationist Prime Minister of Greece during the Axis Occupation.
Events.html: 1943 – Ioannis Rallis becomes collaborationist Prime Minister of Greece during the Axis Occupation.

Events.text: World War II: The Yamato, one of the two largest battleships ever constructed, is sunk by American aircraft during Operation Ten-Go.
Events.html: World War II: The Yamato, one of the two largest battleships ever constructed, is sunk by American aircraft during Operation Ten-Go.

Events.text: World War II: Visoko is liberated by the 7th, 9th, and 17th Krajina brigades from the Tenth division of Yugoslav Partisan forces.
Events.html: 1945 – World War II: Visoko is liberated by the 7th, 9th, and 17th Krajina brigades from the Tenth division of Yugoslav Partisan forces.

Events.text: Syria's independence from France is officially recognised.
Events.html: Syria's independence from France is officially recognised.

Events.text: The World Health Organization is established by the United Nations.
Events.html: The World Health Organization is established by the United Nations.

Events.text: The Rodgers and Hammerstein musical South Pacific opened on Broadway; it would run for 1,925 performances and win ten Tony Awards.
Events.html: The Rodgers and Hammerstein musical South Pacific opened on Broadway; it would run for 1,925 performances and win ten Tony Awards.

Events.text: United States President Dwight D. Eisenhower gives his "domino theory" speech during a news conference.
Events.html: United States President Dwight D. Eisenhower gives his "domino theory" speech during a news conference.

Events.text: Winston Churchill resigns as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom amid indications of failing health.
Events.html: Winston Churchill resigns as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom amid indications of failing health.

links.title: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

Events.text: IBM announces the System/360.
Events.html: IBM announces the System/360.

Events.text: A bulldozer kills Rev. Bruce W. Klunder, a civil rights activist, during a school segregation protest in Cleveland, Ohio, sparking a riot.
Events.html: 1964 – A bulldozer kills Rev. Bruce W. Klunder, a civil rights activist, during a school segregation protest in Cleveland, Ohio, sparking a riot.

Events.text: Motor racing world champion Jim Clark is killed in an accident during a Formula Two race at Hockenheim.
Events.html: Motor racing world champion Jim Clark is killed in an accident during a Formula Two race at Hockenheim.

Events.text: The Internet's symbolic birth date: Publication of RFC 1.
Events.html: The Internet's symbolic birth date: Publication of RFC 1.

Events.text: President Richard Nixon announces his decision to quicken the pace of Vietnamization.
Events.html: President Richard Nixon announces his decision to quicken the pace of Vietnamization.

Events.text: Member of Parliament and suspected spy John Stonehouse resigns from the Labour Party (UK) after being arrested for faking his own death.
Events.html: Member of Parliament and suspected spy John Stonehouse resigns from the Labour Party (UK) after being arrested for faking his own death.

Events.text: German Federal prosecutor Siegfried Buback and his driver are shot by two Red Army Faction members while waiting at a red light.
Events.html: German Federal prosecutor Siegfried Buback and his driver are shot by two Red Army Faction members while waiting at a red light.

Events.text: Development of the neutron bomb is canceled by President Jimmy Carter.
Events.html: Development of the neutron bomb is canceled by President Jimmy Carter.

Events.text: During the Iran hostage crisis, the United States severs relations with Iran.
Events.html: During the Iran hostage crisis, the United States severs relations with Iran.

Events.text: During STS-6, astronauts Story Musgrave and Don Peterson perform the first Space Shuttle spacewalk.
Events.html: During STS-6, astronauts Story Musgrave and Don Peterson perform the first Space Shuttle spacewalk.

Events.text: Soviet submarine Komsomolets sinks in the Barents Sea off the coast of Norway killing 42 sailors.
Events.html: Soviet submarine Komsomolets sinks in the Barents Sea off the coast of Norway killing 42 sailors.

Events.text: Iran–Contra affair: John Poindexter is found guilty of five charges for his part in the scandal (the conviction is later reversed on appeal).
Events.html: Iran–Contra affair: John Poindexter is found guilty of five charges for his part in the scandal (the conviction is later reversed on appeal).

Events.text: A fire breaks out on the passenger ferry Scandinavian Star, killing 159 people.
Events.html: 1990 – A fire breaks out on the passenger ferry Scandinavian Star, killing 159 people.

Events.text: Rwandan genocide: Massacres of Tutsis begin in Kigali, Rwanda.
Events.html: Rwandan genocide: Massacres of Tutsis begin in Kigali, Rwanda.

Events.text: Auburn Calloway attempts to destroy Federal Express Flight 705 in order to allow his family to benefit from his life insurance policy.
Events.html: 1994 – Auburn Calloway attempts to destroy Federal Express Flight 705 in order to allow his family to benefit from his life insurance policy.

Events.text: First Chechen War: Russian paramilitary troops begin a massacre of civilians in Samashki, Chechnya.
Events.html: First Chechen War: Russian paramilitary troops begin a massacre of civilians in Samashki, Chechnya.

Events.text: The World Trade Organization rules in favor of the United States in its long-running trade dispute with the European Union over bananas.
Events.html: The World Trade Organization rules in favor of the United States in its long-running trade dispute with the European Union over bananas.

Events.text: Mars Odyssey is launched.
Events.html: Mars Odyssey is launched.

Events.text: U.S. troops capture Baghdad; Saddam Hussein's regime falls two days later.
Events.html: U.S. troops capture Baghdad; Saddam Hussein's regime falls two days later.

Events.text: Former Peruvian President Alberto Fujimori is sentenced to 25 years in prison for ordering killings and kidnappings by security forces.
Events.html: Former Peruvian President Alberto Fujimori is sentenced to 25 years in prison for ordering killings and kidnappings by security forces.

Events.text: Mass protests begin across Moldova under the belief that results from the parliamentary election are fraudulent.
Events.html: 2009 – Mass protests begin across Moldova under the belief that results from the parliamentary election are fraudulent.

Events.text: 2017 Stockholm attack happened on Drottninggatan in central Stockholm, Sweden. A stolen truck slams into people at high speed, killing five and injuring fifteen others.
Events.html: 2017 Stockholm attack happened on Drottninggatan in central Stockholm, Sweden. A stolen truck slams into people at high speed, killing five and injuring fifteen others.
